name: String literal with whitespace differences
source: SQL string in Python has different internal formatting
description: SQL query string formatting differs but code structure is same
original:
def get_orders(user_id, status=None):
    query = """
        SELECT o.id, o.total, o.created_at,
               u.name as customer_name
        FROM orders o
        JOIN users u ON u.id = o.user_id
        WHERE o.user_id = %s
    """
    params = [user_id]
    if status:
        query += " AND o.status = %s"
        params.append(status)
    return db.execute(query, params)

llm_edit.old_text:
def get_orders(user_id, status=None):
    query = """
      SELECT o.id, o.total, o.created_at,
             u.name as customer_name
      FROM orders o
      JOIN users u ON u.id = o.user_id
      WHERE o.user_id = %s
    """
    params = [user_id]
    if status:
        query += " AND o.status = %s"
        params.append(status)
    return db.execute(query, params)
llm_edit.new_text:
def get_orders(user_id, status=None, limit=50):
    query = """
      SELECT o.id, o.total, o.created_at,
             u.name as customer_name
      FROM orders o
      JOIN users u ON u.id = o.user_id
      WHERE o.user_id = %s
    """
    params = [user_id]
    if status:
        query += " AND o.status = %s"
        params.append(status)
    query += " ORDER BY o.created_at DESC LIMIT %s"
    params.append(limit)
    return db.execute(query, params)

expected:
def get_orders(user_id, status=None, limit=50):
    query = """
        SELECT o.id, o.total, o.created_at,
               u.name as customer_name
        FROM orders o
        JOIN users u ON u.id = o.user_id
        WHERE o.user_id = %s
    """
    params = [user_id]
    if status:
        query += " AND o.status = %s"
        params.append(status)
    query += " ORDER BY o.created_at DESC LIMIT %s"
    params.append(limit)
    return db.execute(query, params)
